summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from December 2018 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a request for notes and records from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The chain includes a forwarded 2016 email from Skinner sharing a news article about Epstein and attaching legal documents related to cases against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Kurland, Abigail
persons.context: Addressee in email chain; appears to be coordinating with colleagues to gather information related to Epstein.

persons.name: Kramer, Amanda
persons.context: Sender of initial email requesting notes/records from a meeting with Peter Skinner; works at USANYS (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York).

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.context: Attorney who met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016; forwarded a 2016 email sharing a PageSix article about Epstein and attached legal documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell cases.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Described as a lead attorney on the case, added to the email chain by Peter Skinner in 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; mentioned in relation to a news article about his continued relationships with young women and the legal cases.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a defamation case; motion to dismiss was denied. Legal documents concerning her were attached to Skinner's email.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (cc) on Peter Skinner's 2016 email.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (cc) on Peter Skinner's 2016 email (likely Brad Edwards, but only 'Brad' is listed).

connections.description: Skinner adds McCawley to the email chain as a lead attorney on the case who knows the facts well.
Skinner met with Kramer (and likely other SDNY prosecutors) in 2016 to discuss the Epstein case, as Kramer is later asked for notes from that meeting.
Kramer emails Kurland within the U.S. Attorney's Office to coordinate gathering information on Epstein.
Legal documents concerning Maxwell (defamation case, CVRA case) are being discussed in the context of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: PageSix article on Epstein
events.description: PageSix reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, as shared by Peter Skinner via email.

events.title: Meeting between Skinner and SDNY
events.description: Peter Skinner meets with SDNY prosecutors (likely including Amanda Kramer) to discuss the Epstein case.

events.title: Judge Sweet denies Maxwell's motion
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case.

events.title: SDNY internal follow-up on Epstein
events.description: Amanda Kramer and Abigail Kurland correspond internally to locate notes and records from the 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner as part of getting a 'complete handle on the landscape' of the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: In December 2018, SDNY prosecutors were actively gathering historical notes and records from a 2016 meeting with attorney Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Peter Skinner, in 2016, shared a PageSix news article reporting on Epstein's continued relationships with young women with SDNY prosecutors.
Skinner provided SDNY with legal documents including a complaint in a defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell, declarations and a Rule 56.1 statement from a CVRA case, and a redacted FBI 302 form.
The email chain indicates coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to understand the full 'landscape' of the Epstein case as of late 2018.
